results.title: The Athletes [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in AUstralia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain. Narration is in the Greek language.

results.title: A Japanese Fairy Tale
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Moonbeam princess
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Japanese Fairy Tale”.
A charming Japanese fairytale about a little princess who came to earth on a moonbeam. Three princes who seek her hand in marriage go in search of three rare and precious gifts to give her. Animated puppet figures in beautiful authentic costumes and background settings give a delightful artistic flavour to this original story.

results.title: A Wall of Silence
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Patricia Quinn-Boas who contracted spinal meningitis and is now almost completely deaf as a result. Editor, Sarah Bennett; camera, Tony Wilson.

results.title: A World of his own
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about 10 year old Matthew Ellis who is severely mentally retarded. Editor, Rod Adamson; camera, Tony Wilson.

results.title: Just like other kids: Ramona Marsh
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about 15 year old Ramona Marsh who is partially sighted, a condition she inherited from her mother. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Part of the community
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Joe Reeve who is in a wheel chair as a result of an industrial accident.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implication of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Bruce Ellison who has muscular dystrophy.
